article_title: Obamacare Patients Spend 10% Of Income Out Of Pocket Despite Government Subsidies

article_metadata.description: Even with federal government subsidies under the Affordable Care Act, a typical American buying coverage on public exchanges spends about one in 10 dollars they earn “on insurance premiums and out-of-pocket costs,” according to a new analysis. Research from the Urban Institute shows typical single enrollees with incomes between $23,540 and [...]
article_metadata.author: Bruce Japsen
